5.1.1.1.1.3. spitfire.chemistry.mechanism module¶

This module facilitates loading chemical reaction mechanisms in Cantera format and mixing streams in useful ways.

class spitfire.chemistry.mechanism.CanteraWrapper(mech_xml_path, group_name, solution=None)¶

Bases: object

property group_name¶
property mech_xml_path¶
property solution¶
class spitfire.chemistry.mechanism.ChemicalMechanismSpec(cantera_xml=None, group_name=None, cantera_solution=None)¶

Bases: object

A class that loads chemical mechanisms and mixes streams.

This class facilitates some simple way of specifying the fuel and oxidizer streams for flamelets and of blending these streams to make mixtures for zero-dimensional simulations.

Constructor: specify a chemical mechanism in cantera XML format

Parameters
cantera_xmlstr

a cantera XML file describing the thermochemistry and (optionally) transport properties

group_namestr

the phase to use (e.g. a phase with transport properties vs without, if such a split exists in the XML file)

copy_stream(self, stream)¶

Make a duplicate of a stream - use this to avoid inadvertently modifying a stream by reference.

copy_streams(self, streams)¶

Make a copy of a list of streams, returning a list with copies of each stream.

classmethod from_solution(solution:cantera.composite.Solution)¶
property gas¶

Obtain this mechanism’s cantera Solution object

property griffon¶

Obtain this mechanism’s griffon PyCombustionKernels object

property group_name¶

Obtain the group name of the identified mechanism’s XML specification

property mech_xml_path¶

Obtain the path of the identified mechanism’s XML specification

mix_for_equivalence_ratio(self, phi, fuel, oxy)¶

Mix a stream of fuel and oxidizer such that the mixture has a specified equivalence ratio.

mix_for_normalized_equivalence_ratio(self, normalized_phi, fuel, oxy)¶

Mix a stream of fuel and oxidizer such that the mixture has a specified normalized equivalence ratio.

mix_fuels_for_stoich_mixture_fraction(self, fuel1, fuel2, zstoich, oxy)¶

Mix two fuel streams for a specified stoichiometric mixture fraction given a particular oxidizer. As an example, this can be used to dilute a fuel with Nitrogen to hit a particular stoichiometric mixture fraction.

Note that it is not possible to reach all stoichiometric mixture fractions with any fuel combinations! In such a case this function will throw an error.

static mix_streams(streams, basis, constant='HP')¶

Mix a number of streams by mass/mole and at constant HP, TP, UV, etc. (as supported by Cantera)

Parameters

  • streams – a list of tuples as [(stream, amount)] where amount is the mass/moles (depending on the basis)

  • basis – whether amounts are masses or moles

  • constant – property pair held constant, such as HP, TP, UV - any combination supported by Cantera

Returns

the requested mixture

molecular_weight(self, id)¶
property n_reactions¶

Obtain the number of reactions in this chemical mechanism

property n_species¶

Obtain the number of species in this chemical mechanism

species_index(self, name)¶

Obtain the index of a particular species

property species_names¶

Obtain the names of speciesin this chemical mechanism

stoich_mass_fuel_to_oxy_ratio(self, fuel_stream, oxy_stream)¶

Get the mass ratio of fuel to oxidizer at stoichiometric conditions. Assumes C, O, and H combustion of single fuel and single oxidizer streams.

stoich_mixture_fraction(self, fuel_stream, oxy_stream)¶

Get the mixture fraction at stoichiometric conditions. Assumes C, O, and H combustion of single fuel and single oxidizer streams.

stoich_molar_fuel_to_oxy_ratio(self, fuel_stream, oxy_stream)¶

Get the molar ratio of fuel to oxidizer at stoichiometric conditions. Assumes C, O, and H combustion of single fuel and single oxidizer streams.

stream(self, properties=None, values=None, stp_air=False)¶

Build a mixture of species with certain properties

Parameters

  • properties – a string of keys used in building a cantera Quantity (e.g., ‘TPX’ or ‘TP’ or ‘X’, etc.)

  • values – the values of the properties

  • stp_air – special option to make a stream of air at standard temperature and pressure This produces a stream of 3.74 mol N2 per mole O2 at 300 K and one atmosphere

Returns

a cantera Quantity object with the specified properties
